metadata.section: Advanced Settings Guide â€” NeuraHome Smart Devices

title: advanced_settings_guide.md - 1. Overview
content:
This guide covers advanced settings and configurations for all NeuraHome smart devices, including NH-Hub X1, NH-Cam Pro 360, NH-Lock Secure+, and NH-Bulb Glow RGB+.

---

title: advanced_settings_guide.md - 2. NH-Hub X1 Advanced Settings
content:
### Network Configuration
#### Ethernet Priority
1. App â†’ **Devices â†’ NH-Hub X1 â†’ Settings â†’ Network**
2. Enable **Ethernet Priority**
3. Hub uses Ethernet when available, falls back to WiFi
4. Reduces latency for critical automations

title: advanced_settings_guide.md - 2. NH-Hub X1 Advanced Settings
content:
#### WiFi Band Selection
1. App â†’ **Settings â†’ Network â†’ WiFi**
2. Choose **2.4 GHz Only**, **5 GHz Only**, or **Auto**
3. **2.4 GHz**: Better range, more device compatibility
4. **5 GHz**: Faster speeds, less interference
5. **Auto**: Hub selects best band automatically

title: advanced_settings_guide.md - 2. NH-Hub X1 Advanced Settings
content:
#### Static IP Configuration
1. App â†’ **Network â†’ Advanced â†’ Static IP**
2. Enter:
   - **IP Address** (e.g., 192.168.1.100)
   - **Subnet Mask** (usually 255.255.255.0)
   - **Gateway** (router IP, e.g., 192.168.1.1)
   - **DNS Server** (e.g., 8.8.8.8)
3. Tap **Save**
4. Hub restarts with static IP

title: advanced_settings_guide.md - 2. NH-Hub X1 Advanced Settings
content:
### Device Management
#### Zigbee Channel Selection
1. App â†’ **Hub Settings â†’ Zigbee â†’ Channel**
2. Choose channel **11, 15, 20, or 25**
3. Avoid channels used by WiFi (1, 6, 11)
4. Use channel scanner to find least congested

#### Device Limit Configuration
1. App â†’ **Hub Settings â†’ Device Limits**
2. Set maximum devices:
   - **Zigbee devices**: Up to 200
   - **WiFi devices**: Up to 50
   - **Bluetooth devices**: Up to 30
3. Hub will warn when approaching limits

title: advanced_settings_guide.md - 2. NH-Hub X1 Advanced Settings
content:
#### Device Grouping
1. App â†’ **Devices â†’ Select Multiple Devices**
2. Tap **Group** or **Create Group**
3. Name the group (e.g., "Living Room Lights")
4. Control all devices in group simultaneously
5. Set group schedules and automations

title: advanced_settings_guide.md - 2. NH-Hub X1 Advanced Settings
content:
### Automation Engine
#### Advanced Automation Rules
1. App â†’ **Automation â†’ Create Rule**
2. Set **Triggers**:
   - Time-based (specific time, sunrise, sunset)
   - Device state (motion detected, door opened)
   - Location (geofencing)
   - Multiple conditions (AND/OR logic)
3. Set **Actions**:
   - Control devices
   - Send notifications
   - Run scenes
   - Delay actions
4. Set **Conditions**:
   - Only if certain devices are on/off
   - Only during specific times

title: advanced_settings_guide.md - 2. NH-Hub X1 Advanced Settings
content:
- Only during specific times
   - Only if no one is home

title: advanced_settings_guide.md - 2. NH-Hub X1 Advanced Settings
content:
#### Automation Priorities
1. App â†’ **Automation â†’ Settings â†’ Priorities**
2. Set priority levels (1-10, 1 = highest)
3. Higher priority automations run first
4. Useful for security automations (high priority)

#### Automation Logs
1. App â†’ **Automation â†’ Logs**
2. View automation execution history
3. See which automations ran, failed, or were skipped
4. Debug automation issues

title: advanced_settings_guide.md - 2. NH-Hub X1 Advanced Settings
content:
### Security Settings
#### Local Processing Mode
1. App â†’ **Hub Settings â†’ Security â†’ Local Processing**
2. Enable **Local-Only Mode**
3. All processing happens on hub (no cloud)
4. Faster response, more private
5. Requires hub to be online

#### Encryption Settings
1. App â†’ **Security â†’ Encryption**
2. Verify **AES-256 encryption** is enabled
3. Check **Secure Boot** status
4. Review **Certificate expiration** dates

title: advanced_settings_guide.md - 2. NH-Hub X1 Advanced Settings
content:
#### Access Control
1. App â†’ **Hub Settings â†’ Access Control**
2. Manage who can access hub:
   - **Admin users** (full access)
   - **Standard users** (limited access)
   - **Guest users** (view only)
3. Set user permissions per device

### Performance Optimization
#### Cache Management
1. App â†’ **Hub Settings â†’ Performance â†’ Cache**
2. Clear cache if hub is slow
3. Cache stores frequently accessed data
4. Automatically cleared weekly

title: advanced_settings_guide.md - 2. NH-Hub X1 Advanced Settings
content:
#### Firmware Update Settings
1. App â†’ **Hub Settings â†’ Updates**
2. Choose update mode:
   - **Automatic** (updates at night)
   - **Manual** (you approve updates)
   - **Beta** (early access to features)
3. Set update schedule (recommended: 2-4 AM)

#### Resource Monitoring
1. App â†’ **Hub Settings â†’ Performance**
2. View:
   - **CPU Usage** (should be < 70%)
   - **Memory Usage** (should be < 80%)
   - **Network Traffic**
   - **Connected Devices Count**
3. Restart hub if resources are high

title: advanced_settings_guide.md - 3. NH-Cam Pro 360 Advanced Settings
content:
### Video Quality & Recording
#### Resolution Settings
1. App â†’ **Camera Settings â†’ Video â†’ Resolution**
2. Options:
   - **2K Ultra HD** (2560Ã—1440) - Best quality
   - **1080p Full HD** (1920Ã—1080) - Balanced
   - **720p HD** (1280Ã—720) - Lower bandwidth
3. Higher resolution = more storage needed

#### Frame Rate
1. App â†’ **Video â†’ Frame Rate**
2. Choose **30 fps** (standard) or **15 fps** (saves bandwidth)
3. 30 fps provides smoother video
4. 15 fps reduces storage and bandwidth usage

title: advanced_settings_guide.md - 3. NH-Cam Pro 360 Advanced Settings
content:
#### Recording Modes
1. App â†’ **Camera Settings â†’ Recording**
2. Options:
   - **Event-Only** (records when motion detected)
   - **24/7 Continuous** (records all the time)
   - **Scheduled** (records during specific times)
3. Event-only saves storage space

title: advanced_settings_guide.md - 3. NH-Cam Pro 360 Advanced Settings
content:
#### Storage Management
1. App â†’ **Camera Settings â†’ Storage**
2. Set **Storage Limit** (e.g., 50GB)
3. Choose **Overwrite Mode**:
   - **Oldest First** (deletes oldest videos)
   - **Stop Recording** (stops when full)
4. Enable **Cloud Backup** for important events

title: advanced_settings_guide.md - 3. NH-Cam Pro 360 Advanced Settings
content:
### Motion Detection
#### Detection Zones
1. App â†’ **Camera Settings â†’ Motion â†’ Zones**
2. Draw **custom zones** on camera view
3. Camera only detects motion in selected zones
4. Reduces false alarms from trees, cars, etc.
5. Can create multiple zones

#### Sensitivity Levels
1. App â†’ **Motion â†’ Sensitivity**
2. Levels: **Low, Medium, High, Custom**
3. **Low**: Only large movements detected
4. **High**: Even small movements trigger alerts
5. **Custom**: Set specific thresholds

title: advanced_settings_guide.md - 3. NH-Cam Pro 360 Advanced Settings
content:
#### AI Detection Modes
1. App â†’ **Motion â†’ AI Detection**
2. Enable specific detection types:
   - **Person Detection** (humans only)
   - **Pet Detection** (cats, dogs)
   - **Package Detection** (deliveries)
   - **Vehicle Detection** (cars, bikes)
   - **Sound Detection** (baby crying, loud noises)
3. Reduces false alarms significantly

title: advanced_settings_guide.md - 3. NH-Cam Pro 360 Advanced Settings
content:
#### Alert Settings
1. App â†’ **Motion â†’ Alerts**
2. Configure:
   - **Alert Frequency** (every event, hourly summary, daily summary)
   - **Quiet Hours** (no alerts during sleep)
   - **Alert Methods** (push, email, SMS)
   - **Alert Cooldown** (wait X minutes between alerts)

title: advanced_settings_guide.md - 3. NH-Cam Pro 360 Advanced Settings
content:
### Night Vision Settings
#### IR Mode
1. App â†’ **Camera Settings â†’ Night Vision**
2. Choose **Auto**, **Always On**, or **Always Off**
3. **Auto**: Switches based on light level
4. **Always On**: IR LEDs always active
5. **Always Off**: Color mode only (requires some light)

#### Low-Light Color Mode
1. App â†’ **Night Vision â†’ Low-Light Color**
2. Enable for color video in dim light
3. Uses more power than IR mode
4. Provides color footage at night

title: advanced_settings_guide.md - 3. NH-Cam Pro 360 Advanced Settings
content:
### Privacy & Security
#### Privacy Zones
1. App â†’ **Camera Settings â†’ Privacy**
2. Draw zones to **block from view**
3. These areas appear black in recordings
4. Useful for windows, neighbor's property
5. Privacy zones are permanent (can't be bypassed)

#### Local Storage Encryption
1. App â†’ **Camera Settings â†’ Security â†’ Encryption**
2. Enable **SD Card Encryption**
3. Videos encrypted on SD card
4. Requires password to view on other devices

title: advanced_settings_guide.md - 3. NH-Cam Pro 360 Advanced Settings
content:
#### Access Logs
1. App â†’ **Camera Settings â†’ Security â†’ Access Logs**
2. View who accessed camera and when
3. See remote access attempts
4. Monitor for unauthorized access

title: advanced_settings_guide.md - 4. NH-Lock Secure+ Advanced Settings
content:
### Security Enhancements
#### PIN Complexity
1. App â†’ **Lock Settings â†’ Security â†’ PIN Rules**
2. Enable **Strong PIN Requirement**
3. Requires:
   - Minimum 6 digits
   - Cannot be sequential (123456)
   - Cannot be repeated (111111)
   - Cannot be common patterns

title: advanced_settings_guide.md - 4. NH-Lock Secure+ Advanced Settings
content:
#### Auto-Lock Behavior
1. App â†’ **Lock Settings â†’ Auto-Lock**
2. Options:
   - **Immediate** (locks as soon as door closes)
   - **Delayed** (5-30 seconds after door closes)
   - **Manual Only** (never auto-locks)
3. Set delay time if using delayed mode

title: advanced_settings_guide.md - 4. NH-Lock Secure+ Advanced Settings
content:
#### Lockdown Mode
1. App â†’ **Lock Settings â†’ Security â†’ Lockdown**
2. Configure:
   - **Failed Attempt Limit** (3-10 attempts)
   - **Lockdown Duration** (30-300 seconds)
   - **Admin Override** (admin can unlock during lockdown)
3. Prevents brute force attacks

title: advanced_settings_guide.md - 4. NH-Lock Secure+ Advanced Settings
content:
### Access Scheduling
#### Time-Based Access
1. App â†’ **Lock Settings â†’ Schedules**
2. Create **time-based rules**:
   - **Work Hours** (9 AM - 5 PM weekdays)
   - **Night Mode** (10 PM - 6 AM)
   - **Weekend Schedule**
3. Users can only unlock during allowed times

#### Geofencing
1. App â†’ **Lock Settings â†’ Geofencing**
2. Enable **Auto-Unlock When Arriving**
3. Set **geofence radius** (50-500 meters)
4. Lock unlocks when authorized user enters area
5. Lock locks when all users leave area

title: advanced_settings_guide.md - 4. NH-Lock Secure+ Advanced Settings
content:
### Integration Settings
#### Voice Assistant
1. App â†’ **Lock Settings â†’ Integrations â†’ Voice**
2. Connect to:
   - **Amazon Alexa**
   - **Google Assistant**
   - **Apple HomeKit / Siri**
3. Enable voice commands:
   - "Alexa, lock the front door"
   - "Hey Google, unlock the door"
4. Set voice PIN for security

title: advanced_settings_guide.md - 4. NH-Lock Secure+ Advanced Settings
content:
#### IFTTT Integration
1. App â†’ **Lock Settings â†’ Integrations â†’ IFTTT**
2. Enable **IFTTT Webhooks**
3. Create applets for:
   - Lock door when leaving home
   - Unlock when arriving
   - Send notifications to other services

content:

title: advanced_settings_guide.md - 5. NH-Bulb Glow RGB+ Advanced Settings
content:

title: advanced_settings_guide.md - 5. NH-Bulb Glow RGB+ Advanced Settings
content:
### Scheduling & Automation
#### Sunrise/Sunset Schedules
1. App â†’ **Bulb Settings â†’ Schedules â†’ Sun**
2. Set **Sunrise/Sunset** actions:
   - Turn on at sunset
   - Turn off at sunrise

title: advanced_settings_guide.md - 5. NH-Bulb Glow RGB+ Advanced Settings
content:

2. Tap **Group** or **Create Group**

content:

title: advanced_settings_guide.md - 6. App-Wide Advanced Settings
content:
### Account Management
#### Multi-Home Support
1. App â†’ **Settings â†’ Homes**
2. Add multiple homes/locations
3. Switch between homes

#### User Roles & Permissions

content:
### Notifications

1. App â†’ **Settings â†’ Notifications â†’ Rules**

content:

### Backup & Sync
#### Cloud Backup
1. App â†’ **Settings â†’ Backup â†’ Cloud**
2. Enable **Automatic Cloud Backup**

title: advanced_settings_guide.md - 6. App-Wide Advanced Settings
content:
#### Local Backup

---

title: advanced_settings_guide.md - 7. Troubleshooting Advanced Settings
content:
### Settings Not Saving
**Solutions:**
1. Check internet connection
2. Ensure device is online
3. Restart the app
4. Clear app cache
5. Update app to latest version

### Changes Not Taking Effect
**Solutions:**
1. Wait 10-30 seconds for sync
2. Restart the device
3. Check device firmware is up to date
4. Verify settings were saved correctly
5. Contact support if issue persists

metadata.section: NH-Bulb Glow RGB+ â€” Smart Bulb

title: nh_bulb_glow_rgb_manual.md - 1. Product Overview
content:
The **NH-Bulb Glow RGB+** is a Wi-Fi-enabled smart LED bulb that allows full **color customization, scheduling, dimming, and automation** through the NeuraHome App.  
Key features:  
- 16 million colors + adjustable white temperature  
- Energy-efficient LED  
- Voice control (Alexa / Google Home / Siri)  
- Automation & scheduling  
- Remote control via app  
- Grouping multiple bulbs  

---

title: nh_bulb_glow_rgb_manual.md - 2. Whatâ€™s in the Box
content:
- 1 Ã— NH-Bulb Glow RGB+ (E26/E27 socket)  
- 1 Ã— Quick Start Guide  

---

title: nh_bulb_glow_rgb_manual.md - 3. Technical Specifications
content:
| Feature | Details |
|--------|---------|
| Model | NH-Bulb Glow RGB+ |
| Wattage | 9W (equivalent to 60W incandescent) |
| Lumen Output | 800 lm |
| Color Temperature | 2700K â€“ 6500K + RGB |
| Connectivity | Wi-Fi 2.4 GHz |
| Lifetime | 25,000 hours |
| Voltage | 100â€“240V AC |
| Dimmable | Yes (via app or voice) |
| Energy Rating | A+ |

---

title: nh_bulb_glow_rgb_manual.md - 4. Installation & Setup
content:
### Step 1 â€” Install the Bulb
- Screw into standard E26/E27 socket  
- Ensure power is off before installation

### Step 2 â€” Power On
- Switch on the wall power  
- Bulb will blink **white** indicating pairing mode

### Step 3 â€” Pair via App
1. Open NeuraHome App â†’ **Add Device â†’ Smart Bulb**  
2. Select **NH-Bulb Glow RGB+**  
3. Ensure phone is connected to 2.4 GHz Wi-Fi  
4. Follow on-screen instructions

title: nh_bulb_glow_rgb_manual.md - 4. Installation & Setup
content:
### Step 4 â€” Optional Grouping
- Add multiple bulbs to a **room or group** for synchronized control

---

title: nh_bulb_glow_rgb_manual.md - 5. Mobile App Controls
content:
- Turn On/Off  
- Adjust brightness (0â€“100%)  
- Change color (RGB or presets)  
- White temperature adjustment (2700Kâ€“6500K)  
- Set schedules / timers  
- Automation (e.g., turn on when motion detected by NH-Cam)  
- Scene presets: Reading, Relax, Night, Party  

---

title: nh_bulb_glow_rgb_manual.md - 6. LED Indicator Guide
content:
| Status | Meaning |
|--------|---------|
| Blinking White | Ready for pairing |
| Solid White | Connected to Wi-Fi |
| Blinking Blue | Firmware update in progress |
| Blinking Red | Connection error |
| No light | Power off or bulb faulty |

---

title: nh_bulb_glow_rgb_manual.md - 7. Scheduling & Automation
content:
- **Time-based scheduling:** Turn on/off at set times  
- **Sunrise/sunset mode:** Automatically adjusts brightness  
- **Event triggers:** Link with motion sensors or cameras for smart automation  
- **Group automation:** Control all bulbs in a room simultaneously  

---

title: nh_bulb_glow_rgb_manual.md - 8. Firmware Updates
content:
- Automatic by default  
- Manual update via App â†’ Device Settings â†’ Firmware Update  
- Ensure Wi-Fi is stable  
- Avoid power interruption during update  

---

title: nh_bulb_glow_rgb_manual.md - 9. Troubleshooting
content:
### Bulb not connecting
- Check 2.4 GHz Wi-Fi  
- Ensure bulb in pairing mode  
- Reset bulb (power off/on 3 times)

### Bulb flickering
- Ensure bulb screwed in tightly  
- Check voltage compatibility  
- Verify app brightness level

### Remote control not working
- Ensure app updated to latest version  
- Check phone Wi-Fi connection  
- Remove & re-add bulb in app if needed

---

title: nh_bulb_glow_rgb_manual.md - 10. Error Codes
content:
| Code | Meaning | Action |
|------|---------|--------|
| B101 | Wi-Fi not detected | Reconnect to 2.4GHz network |
| B202 | Firmware update failed | Retry in app |
| B303 | Power fluctuation detected | Check socket |
| B404 | Bulb not responding | Power cycle bulb |
| B505 | Group sync failed | Refresh group in app |

---

title: nh_bulb_glow_rgb_manual.md - 11. Safety & Maintenance
content:
- Do not cover bulb during operation  
- Do not expose to water  
- Use in standard E26/E27 socket only  
- Keep away from heat sources  
- Clean with dry cloth only  

---

title: nh_bulb_glow_rgb_manual.md - 12. Warranty Summary
content:
- **1-year limited warranty**  
- Covers manufacturing defects  
- Excludes: misuse, water damage, power surges  

---

title: nh_bulb_glow_rgb_manual.md - 13. Support
content:
- Website: neurahome.com/support  
- Email: support@neurahome.com  
- Hotline: +1-800-NEURA-HOME

metadata.section: NH-Lock Secure+ â€” Smart Door Lock

title: nh_lock_secure_plus_manual.md - 1. Product Overview
content:
The **NH-Lock Secure+** is an advanced smart door lock designed for modern home security.  
It supports **Bluetooth, Wi-Fi, PIN unlock, fingerprint scanning, mobile app control, temporary guest access**, and **real-time activity logs**.

Ideal for apartments, homes, rental properties, and office use.

---

title: nh_lock_secure_plus_manual.md - 2. Whatâ€™s in the Box
content:
- NH-Lock Secure+ Smart Lock  
- Interior mounting plate  
- Exterior keypad module  
- Fingerprint sensor module  
- Battery pack (4Ã— AA)  
- Backup key (2Ã—)  
- Screw set  
- User manual  
- Warranty card

---

title: nh_lock_secure_plus_manual.md - 3. Technical Specifications
content:
| Feature | Details |
|--------|---------|
| Connectivity | Wi-Fi 2.4 GHz, Bluetooth BLE 5.0 |
| Power | 4Ã— AA batteries (6â€“10 months) |
| Authentication | PIN, fingerprint (up to 100 prints), mobile app, physical key |
| Material | Zinc alloy (front), ABS (interior) |
| Operating Temp | -10Â°C to 55Â°C |
| Door Compatibility | 35â€“55 mm thickness |
| Security Grade | ANSI Grade 2 |

---

title: nh_lock_secure_plus_manual.md - 4. Installation & Setup
content:
### Tools Required  
- Screwdriver  
- Drill (only if old lock holes differ)

### Steps  
1. Remove the existing door lock hardware.  
2. Install the exterior keypad module.  
3. Place the interior mounting plate and secure with provided screws.  
4. Connect the cable between the keypad and interior module.  
5. Insert the battery pack and secure the interior cover.  
6. Power on the device â€” the keypad lights will flash **blue**.  
7. Proceed with app pairing.

---

title: nh_lock_secure_plus_manual.md - 5. Mobile App Pairing
content:
### Steps  
1. Open **NeuraHome App â†’ Add Device â†’ Smart Lock**.  
2. Enable **Bluetooth & Location** on your phone.  
3. Press and hold the `#` key for 3 seconds until the keypad flashes **blue**.  
4. The app will discover `NH-Lock Secure+`.  
5. Select your Wi-Fi network and enter the password.  
6. Wait for configuration (10â€“15 seconds).  
7. App will show â€œDevice Connectedâ€.

---

title: nh_lock_secure_plus_manual.md - 6. LED & Keypad Indicator Guide
content:
| Indicator | Meaning |
|----------|---------|
| Blue (slow blink) | Ready for pairing |
| Blue (solid) | Successfully connected |
| Green | Correct PIN / fingerprint accepted |
| Red | Incorrect PIN / fingerprint |
| Red (fast blink) | Low battery |
| Yellow | System configuration or firmware update |

---

title: nh_lock_secure_plus_manual.md - 7. Device Controls
content:
### Unlock Methods  
- **PIN Unlock:**  
  Enter PIN â†’ press `#`.  
- **Fingerprint Unlock:**  
  Place finger on scanner for 1 sec.  
- **App Remote Unlock:**  
  Tap **Unlock** in app â†’ Cloud verifies â†’ Door opens.  
- **Backup Physical Key:**  
  Hidden key slot under top cover.

### Lock Methods  
- Auto-lock after **5â€“30 seconds** (configurable).  
- Manual lock: press and hold `*` for 2 seconds.  
- Lock via app: tap **Lock**.

---

title: nh_lock_secure_plus_manual.md - 8. Temporary Guest PINs
content:
### Create Guest PIN  
1. App â†’ Smart Lock â†’ Guest Access.  
2. Select validity:  
   - One-time  
   - Time-limited  
   - Recurring  
3. Share PIN via WhatsApp/SMS/email.

### Revoke Guest PIN  
App â†’ Guest Access â†’ Select PIN â†’ Delete.

---

title: nh_lock_secure_plus_manual.md - 9. Firmware Updates
content:
1. App â†’ Device Settings â†’ Firmware Update.  
2. Ensure lock battery > 40%.  
3. Update takes 2â€“3 minutes.  
4. Lock LEDs show **yellow** during update.

---

title: nh_lock_secure_plus_manual.md - 10. Activity Logs
content:
The device maintains cloud-synced logs including:  
- Unlock method (PIN / fingerprint / app)  
- Timestamp  
- User profile  
- Failed attempts  
- Low-battery warnings

Logs are available for **90 days**.

---

title: nh_lock_secure_plus_manual.md - 11. Error Codes
content:
| Code | Meaning | Action |
|------|---------|--------|
| E01 | Fingerprint sensor error | Clean sensor, retry |
| E02 | Motor jam | Check alignment |
| E03 | Network connection failed | Reconnect Wi-Fi |
| E04 | Low battery | Replace batteries |
| E05 | Incorrect PIN attempts exceeded | Lockdown for 60 sec |
| E06 | Firmware update failed | Retry in app |

---

title: nh_lock_secure_plus_manual.md - 12. Troubleshooting
content:
### Lock not responding  
- Remove and reinsert batteries.  
- Check that ribbon cable is properly connected.

### Bluetooth not connecting  
- Move phone closer to lock (< 1 meter).  
- Restart the app.

### Wi-Fi keeps disconnecting  
- Ensure door area has strong 2.4 GHz signal.  
- Avoid metal doors blocking signals.  
- Reset Wi-Fi settings in app.

---

title: nh_lock_secure_plus_manual.md - 13. Safety & Maintenance
content:
- Do not expose to direct rain (use shield for outdoor installation).  
- Replace batteries every 6â€“10 months.  
- Clean keypad with soft cloth only.  
- Avoid storing backup keys near the door.  
- Keep firmware updated.

---

title: nh_lock_secure_plus_manual.md - 14. Warranty Summary
content:
- **2-year limited warranty**  
- Covers manufacturing defects  
- Excludes: improper installation, water damage, forced entry, unauthorized modifications

---

title: nh_lock_secure_plus_manual.md - 15. Support
content:
- Website: neurahome.com/support  
- Email: support@neurahome.com  
- Hotline: +1-800-NEURA-HOME

content:
**NeuraHome Systems**

metadata.section: NH-Lock Secure+ â€” User Management Guide

title: nh_lock_user_management.md - 1. Overview
content:
The NH-Lock Secure+ supports comprehensive user management through the NeuraHome mobile app. You can add permanent users, manage permissions, set up fingerprints, and configure access schedules.

---

title: nh_lock_user_management.md - 2. User Types & Permissions
content:
### Admin User
- **Full access** to all lock functions
- Can add/remove users
- Can modify settings
- Can view all activity logs
- Can manage guest access
- **First user** who pairs the lock becomes the admin

### Standard User
- Can unlock/lock the door
- Can view their own activity logs
- Cannot modify settings
- Cannot add/remove other users
- Can be assigned specific access schedules

title: nh_lock_user_management.md - 2. User Types & Permissions
content:
### Guest User
- Temporary access with PIN only
- Time-limited or one-time use
- Cannot use fingerprint
- Cannot view activity logs
- Automatically expires based on settings

---

title: nh_lock_user_management.md - 3. Adding a New Permanent User
content:
### Method 1: Add User via App (Recommended)
1. Open **NeuraHome App**
2. Navigate to **Devices â†’ NH-Lock Secure+**
3. Tap **User Management** or **Users**
4. Tap **+ Add User** or **Add New User**
5. Enter user details:
   - **Name** (e.g., "John Smith", "Family Member")
   - **Email** (optional, for notifications)
   - **Phone number** (optional)
6. Choose authentication method:
   - **PIN Code** (4-8 digits)
   - **Fingerprint** (requires physical access)
   - **Both PIN and Fingerprint**

title: nh_lock_user_management.md - 3. Adding a New Permanent User
content:
- **Both PIN and Fingerprint**
7. Tap **Save** or **Create User**

title: nh_lock_user_management.md - 3. Adding a New Permanent User
content:
### Method 2: Add User with Fingerprint
1. Follow steps 1-5 from Method 1
2. Select **Fingerprint** or **Both**
3. Tap **Start Fingerprint Enrollment**
4. Have the new user place their finger on the sensor
5. Lift and place finger again (repeat 3-5 times)
6. App will confirm when fingerprint is registered
7. Tap **Complete** to finish

title: nh_lock_user_management.md - 3. Adding a New Permanent User
content:
### Method 3: Quick Add via Keypad
1. Admin user enters their PIN on the lock keypad
2. Press and hold `*` for 5 seconds
3. Keypad will flash **yellow** (admin mode)
4. Enter `#` + `1` (add user mode)
5. New user enters their desired PIN (4-8 digits)
6. Press `#` to confirm
7. Lock will flash **green** when user is added

---

title: nh_lock_user_management.md - 4. Adding Fingerprints to Existing Users
content:
### Steps
1. App â†’ **Devices â†’ NH-Lock Secure+ â†’ User Management**
2. Select the user you want to add fingerprint to
3. Tap **Add Fingerprint** or **Enroll Fingerprint**
4. Have the user place their finger on the lock's fingerprint sensor
5. Lift and place finger again (repeat 3-5 times for better accuracy)
6. App will show progress: "Enrolling... 1/5", "2/5", etc.
7. When complete, app shows "Fingerprint enrolled successfully"

title: nh_lock_user_management.md - 4. Adding Fingerprints to Existing Users
content: 8. You can add up to **3 fingerprints per user** for different fingers

title: nh_lock_user_management.md - 4. Adding Fingerprints to Existing Users
content:
### Tips for Better Fingerprint Recognition
- Clean the sensor before enrollment
- Use dry, clean fingers
- Enroll the same finger multiple times from different angles
- Enroll both index fingers for convenience
- Re-enroll if fingerprint recognition becomes unreliable

---

title: nh_lock_user_management.md - 5. Removing Users
content:
### Remove User via App
1. App â†’ **Devices â†’ NH-Lock Secure+ â†’ User Management**
2. Find the user you want to remove
3. Tap the user's name or settings icon
4. Scroll down and tap **Remove User** or **Delete User**
5. Confirm removal (this action cannot be undone)
6. User's PIN and fingerprints will be deleted immediately

title: nh_lock_user_management.md - 5. Removing Users
content:
### Remove User via Keypad (Admin Only)
1. Admin enters their PIN on keypad
2. Press and hold `*` for 5 seconds (admin mode)
3. Enter `#` + `2` (remove user mode)
4. Enter the user's PIN to remove
5. Press `#` to confirm
6. Lock flashes **red** then **green** when removed

### Bulk Remove Users
1. App â†’ **User Management**
2. Tap **Select** or **Edit Mode**
3. Select multiple users
4. Tap **Delete** or **Remove Selected**
5. Confirm deletion

---

title: nh_lock_user_management.md - 6. Editing User Information
content:
### Change User Name
1. App â†’ **User Management â†’ Select User**
2. Tap **Edit** or user name
3. Modify the name
4. Tap **Save**

### Change User PIN
1. App â†’ **User Management â†’ Select User**
2. Tap **Change PIN** or **Security Settings**
3. Enter new PIN (4-8 digits)
4. Confirm new PIN
5. Tap **Save**

title: nh_lock_user_management.md - 6. Editing User Information
content:
### Remove Fingerprint
1. App â†’ **User Management â†’ Select User**
2. Tap **Fingerprints** or **Biometric Settings**
3. Select the fingerprint to remove
4. Tap **Delete** or **Remove**
5. Confirm deletion

---

title: nh_lock_user_management.md - 7. User Permissions & Access Control
content:
### Set Access Schedule
1. App â†’ **User Management â†’ Select User**
2. Tap **Access Schedule** or **Time Restrictions**
3. Choose schedule type:
   - **Always** (24/7 access)
   - **Weekdays Only** (Monday-Friday)
   - **Weekends Only** (Saturday-Sunday)
   - **Custom Schedule** (set specific days and times)
4. For custom schedule:
   - Select days of week
   - Set start time and end time
   - Tap **Save**
5. User can only unlock during scheduled times

title: nh_lock_user_management.md - 7. User Permissions & Access Control
content:
### Restrict Unlock Methods
1. App â†’ **User Management â†’ Select User**
2. Tap **Unlock Methods** or **Access Methods**
3. Enable/disable:
   - **PIN Code**
   - **Fingerprint**
   - **App Remote Unlock**
4. Save changes

### View-Only Access
1. App â†’ **User Management â†’ Select User**
2. Enable **View Logs Only**
3. User can see activity logs but cannot unlock door

---

title: nh_lock_user_management.md - 8. Guest Access Management
content:
### Create Guest PIN
1. App â†’ **Devices â†’ NH-Lock Secure+ â†’ Guest Access**
2. Tap **+ Add Guest PIN**
3. Enter guest name (optional)
4. Set PIN (4-8 digits)
5. Choose access type:
   - **One-time use** (expires after first unlock)
   - **Time-limited** (set expiration date/time)
   - **Recurring** (e.g., every Monday 9 AM - 5 PM)
6. Set number of uses (if applicable)
7. Tap **Create** or **Save**

title: nh_lock_user_management.md - 8. Guest Access Management
content:
### Share Guest PIN
1. App â†’ **Guest Access â†’ Select Guest PIN**
2. Tap **Share** or **Send PIN**
3. Choose method:
   - **SMS/Text Message**
   - **Email**
   - **WhatsApp**
   - **Copy to Clipboard**
4. Guest receives PIN with instructions

### Revoke Guest Access
1. App â†’ **Guest Access**
2. Find the guest PIN
3. Tap **Revoke** or **Delete**
4. PIN is immediately deactivated

title: nh_lock_user_management.md - 8. Guest Access Management
content:
### View Guest Activity
1. App â†’ **Guest Access â†’ Select Guest PIN**
2. Tap **Activity Log** or **Usage History**
3. View unlock attempts, timestamps, and success/failure

---

title: nh_lock_user_management.md - 9. User Activity Logs
content:
### View All Activity
1. App â†’ **Devices â†’ NH-Lock Secure+ â†’ Activity Logs**
2. View list of all unlock/lock events
3. Filter by:
   - **User** (select specific user)
   - **Date Range** (last 7 days, 30 days, 90 days)
   - **Unlock Method** (PIN, fingerprint, app, key)
   - **Status** (successful, failed)

title: nh_lock_user_management.md - 9. User Activity Logs
content:
### Activity Log Details
Each log entry shows:
- **Timestamp** (date and time)
- **User Name** (who unlocked)
- **Unlock Method** (PIN, fingerprint, app, physical key)
- **Status** (Success/Failed)
- **Location** (if multiple locks)

### Export Activity Logs
1. App â†’ **Activity Logs**
2. Tap **Export** or **Share**
3. Choose format: **PDF** or **CSV**
4. Select date range
5. Export to email or cloud storage

---

title: nh_lock_user_management.md - 10. Advanced User Settings
content:
### Maximum Failed Attempts
1. App â†’ **Devices â†’ NH-Lock Secure+ â†’ Security Settings**
2. Set **Max Failed Attempts** (default: 5)
3. After limit reached, lock enters **lockdown mode** for 60 seconds
4. Admin can adjust this value (3-10 attempts)

### Auto-Lock Delay
1. App â†’ **Devices â†’ NH-Lock Secure+ â†’ Settings**
2. Set **Auto-Lock Delay** (5-30 seconds)
3. Door automatically locks after delay
4. Can be disabled for manual locking only

title: nh_lock_user_management.md - 10. Advanced User Settings
content:
### Silent Mode
1. App â†’ **User Management â†’ Select User**
2. Enable **Silent Mode**
3. Lock operates without beeps or LED flashes
4. Useful for night-time use

### Notification Settings
1. App â†’ **User Management â†’ Select User**
2. Tap **Notifications**
3. Enable/disable:
   - **Unlock Notifications** (get notified when user unlocks)
   - **Failed Attempt Alerts**
   - **Low Battery Warnings**
   - **Activity Summary** (daily/weekly)

---

title: nh_lock_user_management.md - 11. Troubleshooting User Management
content:
### User Cannot Be Added
**Possible Causes:**
- Maximum users reached (lock supports up to 50 users)
- Admin PIN incorrect
- Bluetooth connection lost
- Lock battery too low

**Solutions:**
1. Remove unused users to free up space
2. Verify admin PIN is correct
3. Move phone closer to lock (< 1 meter)
4. Replace lock batteries
5. Restart the app and retry

title: nh_lock_user_management.md - 11. Troubleshooting User Management
content:
### Fingerprint Not Enrolling
**Possible Causes:**
- Sensor dirty or damaged
- Finger too wet or dry
- Too many fingerprints already enrolled (max 100 total)

**Solutions:**
1. Clean fingerprint sensor with soft cloth
2. Dry hands completely before enrollment
3. Remove old unused fingerprints
4. Try different finger (index finger works best)
5. Ensure good lighting during enrollment

title: nh_lock_user_management.md - 11. Troubleshooting User Management
content:
### User PIN Not Working
**Possible Causes:**
- PIN was changed or removed
- User access schedule restricts access
- Lock in lockdown mode (too many failed attempts)

**Solutions:**
1. Verify PIN in app user management
2. Check user's access schedule
3. Wait for lockdown period to expire (60 seconds)
4. Admin can reset user PIN in app
5. Use physical key as backup

title: nh_lock_user_management.md - 11. Troubleshooting User Management
content:
### User Cannot See Activity Logs
**Possible Causes:**
- User doesn't have permission to view logs
- Logs older than 90 days (automatically deleted)
- App not synced with cloud

**Solutions:**
1. Admin must grant "View Logs" permission
2. Activity logs only kept for 90 days
3. Refresh app or check internet connection
4. Admin can export and share logs

---

title: nh_lock_user_management.md - 12. Best Practices
content:
### Security Recommendations
- **Change default admin PIN** immediately after setup
- **Use strong PINs** (6-8 digits, avoid common patterns like 1234)
- **Regularly review** user list and remove unused users
- **Enable notifications** for all unlock events
- **Set access schedules** for users who don't need 24/7 access
- **Use fingerprints** for primary users (more secure than PINs)
- **Regularly update firmware** for security patches

title: nh_lock_user_management.md - 12. Best Practices
content:
### User Management Tips
- **Name users clearly** (e.g., "John - Main User", "Guest - Weekend")
- **Add multiple fingerprints** per user for reliability
- **Test user access** after adding to ensure it works
- **Document guest PINs** and expiration dates
- **Review activity logs weekly** for suspicious activity
- **Remove users immediately** when they no longer need access

---

title: nh_lock_user_management.md - 13. Support
content:
For additional help with user management:
- **Email:** support@neurahome.com
- **Hotline:** +1-800-NEURA-HOME
- **Live Chat:** Available in NeuraHome App

title: data_collection_policy.md - 1. Overview
content:
NeuraHome Systems IoT devices collect data to provide **smart home automation, analytics, and improved user experience**.  
This policy explains what data is collected, how it is stored, and how it is used.

---

title: data_collection_policy.md - 2. Types of Data Collected
content:
### a) Device Telemetry
- Device status (on/off, settings, battery level)  
- Sensor readings (temperature, motion, door status)  
- Connectivity logs (Wi-Fi strength, uptime)  

### b) User Interaction Data
- App interactions (device control, automation rules)  
- Commands via voice assistants  
- Notifications received / dismissed  

### c) Event Logs
- Security events (door unlocks, motion detected, alerts)  
- System errors and firmware updates  
- Automation trigger history  

---

title: data_collection_policy.md - 3. How Data is Collected
content:
- Directly from IoT devices over secure channels  
- Via mobile app interactions  
- Cloud servers aggregate and store telemetry data  

---

title: data_collection_policy.md - 4. Purpose of Data Collection
content:
- Ensure proper device functioning and uptime  
- Provide analytics for smart automation suggestions  
- Detect and troubleshoot errors remotely  
- Enable notifications and alerts for users  
- Improve AI models for motion/person detection  

---

title: data_collection_policy.md - 5. Data Storage & Security
content:
- All data encrypted with **AES-256**  
- Cloud storage in secure, certified data centers  
- Access restricted to authorized personnel  
- Retention period:  
  - Event logs: 90 days  
  - User preferences and account info: until account deletion  

---

title: data_collection_policy.md - 6. User Control & Privacy
content:
- Users can **opt-out** of non-essential data collection in app settings  
- Users can request **export or deletion** of collected data  
- Only anonymized data used for analytics or AI improvements  

---

title: data_collection_policy.md - 7. Sharing Data
content:
- Data shared with third-party services **only with consent** (e.g., Alexa, Google Home)  
- Law enforcement requests processed according to law  
- Aggregated anonymized data may be used for research or product improvement  

---

title: data_collection_policy.md - 8. Compliance
content:
- GDPR, CCPA, and other relevant privacy laws  
- Users have the right to access, correct, and delete personal data  

---

title: data_collection_policy.md - 9. Contact
content:
- Email: dataprivacy@neurahome.com  
- Hotline: +1-800-NEURA-HOME

title: app_errors_troubleshooting.md - 1. Issue: App crashes on launch
content:
### Causes
- Outdated app version  
- Corrupted cache or data  
- Device OS compatibility issues  

### Solutions
1. Update NeuraHome app to latest version.  
2. Clear app cache and storage (Settings â†’ Apps â†’ NeuraHome â†’ Clear Cache/Data).  
3. Restart mobile device.  
4. Reinstall the app if issue persists.  

---

title: app_errors_troubleshooting.md - 2. Issue: Cannot log in
content:
### Causes
- Incorrect credentials  
- Account not verified  
- Server maintenance  

### Solutions
1. Verify username and password.  
2. Reset password via â€œForgot Passwordâ€.  
3. Ensure email account is verified.  
4. Retry after maintenance window.  

---

title: app_errors_troubleshooting.md - 3. Issue: Devices not appearing in app
content:
### Causes
- Device offline or unpaired  
- Hub offline  
- Network issues  

### Solutions
1. Confirm device is powered on and online.  
2. Check hub status and connectivity.  
3. Refresh device list in app.  
4. Re-pair device if necessary.  

---

metadata.section: 3. Issue: Devices not appearing in app

title: app_errors_troubleshooting.md - 4. Issue: Notifications not received
content:
### Causes
- Push notifications disabled  
- Do Not Disturb mode active  
- Device offline  

### Solutions
1. Enable push notifications in app settings.  
2. Check phone DND or battery saver mode.  
3. Ensure devices are online and synced.  

---

title: app_errors_troubleshooting.md - 5. Issue: App slow or unresponsive
content:
### Solutions
1. Close other background apps to free memory.  
2. Update app and device firmware to latest versions.  
3. Restart phone and hub.  
4. Reduce number of devices connected to hub if possible.

title: automation_troubleshooting.md - Automation Troubleshooting Guide
content:
**NeuraHome Systems**

---

title: automation_troubleshooting.md - 1. Overview
content:
This guide helps troubleshoot automation issues, including rules not triggering, conflicting automations, and performance problems.

---

title: automation_troubleshooting.md - 2. Automation Not Triggering
content:
### Rule Not Executing
**Symptoms:**
- Automation created but never runs
- Trigger conditions met but no action
- No errors shown

**Solutions:**
1. **Verify Automation Enabled:**
   - App â†’ Automation â†’ Select Rule
   - Ensure "Enabled" toggle is ON
   - Check if paused or disabled

2. **Check Trigger Conditions:**
   - Review all trigger conditions
   - Ensure ALL conditions are met (if using AND logic)
   - Test trigger manually

title: automation_troubleshooting.md - 2. Automation Not Triggering
content:
3. **Verify Device Status:**
   - Ensure trigger device is online
   - Check device is responding
   - Test device control manually

4. **Check Automation Logs:**
   - App â†’ Automation â†’ Logs
   - See if automation attempted to run
   - Check for error messages

### Automation Runs But Action Fails
**Symptoms:**
- Automation triggers correctly
- Action device doesn't respond
- Partial execution

title: automation_troubleshooting.md - 2. Automation Not Triggering
content:
**Solutions:**
1. **Check Action Device:**
   - Verify device is online
   - Test device control manually
   - Check device battery/power

2. **Review Action Settings:**
   - Verify action is configured correctly
   - Check device name matches
   - Ensure action is valid

3. **Check Device Limits:**
   - Some devices have rate limits
   - Too many commands may be ignored
   - Add delays between actions

title: automation_troubleshooting.md - 2. Automation Not Triggering
content:
### Delayed Automation Execution
**Symptoms:**
- Automation runs but with delay
- Slow response times
- Not executing immediately

**Solutions:**
1. **Check Hub Performance:**
   - Hub Settings â†’ Performance
   - If CPU/Memory high, reduce automations
   - Restart hub if needed

2. **Network Issues:**
   - Check WiFi signal strength
   - Verify devices are online
   - Reduce network congestion

title: automation_troubleshooting.md - 2. Automation Not Triggering
content:
3. **Automation Priority:**
   - Check automation priority settings
   - Lower priority automations may be delayed
   - Increase priority if needed

---

title: automation_troubleshooting.md - 3. Conflicting Automations
content:
### Multiple Automations Interfering
**Symptoms:**
- Devices turn on/off unexpectedly
- Conflicting actions
- Unpredictable behavior

**Solutions:**
1. **Review All Automations:**
   - List all automations affecting same device
   - Identify conflicts
   - Disable or modify conflicting rules

2. **Use Conditions:**
   - Add conditions to prevent conflicts
   - Example: "Only if device is off" before turning on
   - Use time-based conditions

title: automation_troubleshooting.md - 3. Conflicting Automations
content:
3. **Set Priorities:**
   - Assign priorities to automations
   - Higher priority runs first
   - Resolve conflicts in favor of priority

### Automation Loops
**Symptoms:**
- Device turns on/off repeatedly
- Continuous cycling
- Automation triggers itself

**Solutions:**
1. **Break the Loop:**
   - Add condition to prevent re-triggering
   - Example: "Only if device was off for 5 minutes"
   - Use cooldown periods

title: automation_troubleshooting.md - 3. Conflicting Automations
content:
2. **Review Triggers:**
   - Ensure action doesn't trigger same automation
   - Check for circular dependencies
   - Modify trigger conditions

3. **Disable Temporarily:**
   - Disable automation to stop loop
   - Review and fix logic
   - Re-enable after fixing

---

title: automation_troubleshooting.md - 4. Advanced Automation Issues
content:
### Geofencing Not Working
**Symptoms:**
- Auto-unlock when arriving doesn't work
- Location-based automations fail
- Geofence not detected

**Solutions:**
1. **Check Location Permissions:**
   - Phone Settings â†’ Apps â†’ NeuraHome â†’ Permissions
   - Enable "Location - Always"
   - Grant background location access

2. **Verify Geofence Settings:**
   - App â†’ Automation â†’ Geofencing
   - Check radius is appropriate (50-500 meters)
   - Ensure correct location set

title: automation_troubleshooting.md - 4. Advanced Automation Issues
content:
3. **Phone Settings:**
   - Disable battery optimization for app
   - Allow background app refresh
   - Keep app running in background

### Time-Based Automations Off Schedule
**Symptoms:**
- Automations run at wrong time
- Time zone issues
- Sunrise/sunset times incorrect

**Solutions:**
1. **Check Time Zone:**
   - App â†’ Settings â†’ Time Zone
   - Verify correct time zone set
   - Update if changed location

title: automation_troubleshooting.md - 4. Advanced Automation Issues
content:
2. **Verify Schedule:**
   - Review automation schedule
   - Check AM/PM settings
   - Verify days of week

3. **Sunrise/Sunset:**
   - App uses device location for sun times
   - Verify location is correct
   - Manually adjust if needed

---

title: automation_troubleshooting.md - 5. Performance Optimization
content:
### Too Many Automations
**Symptoms:**
- Hub slow to respond
- Automations delayed
- System performance issues

**Solutions:**
1. **Reduce Automation Count:**
   - Combine similar automations
   - Remove unused automations
   - Optimize existing rules

2. **Simplify Logic:**
   - Reduce complex conditions
   - Use simpler triggers
   - Avoid nested conditions

3. **Use Scenes:**
   - Replace multiple automations with scenes
   - Scenes execute faster
   - Easier to manage

title: automation_troubleshooting.md - 5. Performance Optimization
content:
### Automation Best Practices
1. **Group Related Actions:**
   - Use scenes for multiple device control
   - Reduces automation count
   - Faster execution

2. **Use Delays Wisely:**
   - Add delays only when necessary
   - Too many delays slow system
   - Keep delays short (< 30 seconds)

3. **Test Automations:**
   - Test after creating
   - Verify all conditions work
   - Monitor for first few days

---

title: automation_troubleshooting.md - 6. Support
content:
For automation help:
- **Email:** support@neurahome.com
- **Hotline:** +1-800-NEURA-HOME

title: bulb_pairing_issues.md - 1. Issue: Bulb not entering pairing mode
content:
### Causes
- Bulb was already paired to another network  
- Power cycle not performed correctly  

### Solutions
1. Turn bulb **off and on 3 times** to reset.  
2. Ensure wall switch is on during pairing.  
3. Confirm bulb is blinking white before pairing in the app.  

---

metadata.section: 1. Issue: Bulb not entering pairing mode

title: bulb_pairing_issues.md - 2. Issue: App cannot detect bulb
content:
### Causes
- Phone not connected to 2.4 GHz Wi-Fi  
- Bluetooth or location services disabled  

### Solutions
1. Connect phone to **same 2.4 GHz network**.  
2. Enable Bluetooth and location services on your phone.  
3. Restart the NeuraHome app and retry pairing.  

---

title: bulb_pairing_issues.md - 3. Issue: Bulb connects but disconnects frequently
content:
### Causes
- Weak Wi-Fi signal  
- Interference from other devices  

### Solutions
1. Move bulb closer to router.  
2. Reduce the number of devices on the same Wi-Fi network.  
3. Reset bulb and re-add in app if needed.  

---

metadata.section: 3. Issue: Bulb connects but disconnects frequently

title: bulb_pairing_issues.md - 4. Issue: Grouping / Multiple Bulbs not syncing
content:
### Solutions
1. Ensure all bulbs are **on the same Wi-Fi network**.  
2. Refresh device list in app.  
3. Re-add bulbs to the group.  
4. Update bulb firmware to latest version.

metadata.section: 4. Issue: Grouping / Multiple Bulbs not syncing

title: camera_connectivity_troubleshooting.md - 1. Issue: Camera not connecting to Wi-Fi
content:
### Possible Causes
- Wrong Wi-Fi password  
- Using 5 GHz network (camera only supports 2.4 GHz)  
- Router out of range or signal weak  

### Solutions
1. Verify Wi-Fi password and enter again in the app.  
2. Switch to 2.4 GHz network if currently on 5 GHz.  
3. Move camera closer to the router.  
4. Restart the router and camera.  

---

metadata.section: 1. Issue: Camera not connecting to Wi-Fi

title: camera_connectivity_troubleshooting.md - 2. Issue: Camera offline in the app
content:
### Possible Causes
- Power loss  
- Device disconnected from network  
- App not updated  

### Solutions
1. Check power connection.  
2. Ensure Wi-Fi is stable.  
3. Restart the app.  
4. Update camera firmware via the app.  

---

metadata.section: 2. Issue: Camera offline in the app

title: camera_connectivity_troubleshooting.md - 3. Issue: App cannot detect camera during setup
content:
### Solutions
- Make sure phone is on the **same 2.4 GHz network**.  
- Enable Bluetooth and location services.  
- Reset camera by power-cycling 3 times.  
- Retry pairing in the app.  

---

metadata.section: 3. Issue: App cannot detect camera during setup

title: camera_connectivity_troubleshooting.md - 4. Issue: Poor video quality or lag
content:
### Solutions
- Check Wi-Fi signal strength (â‰¥2 Mbps upload).  
- Reduce the number of devices on the same network.  
- Use Ethernet adapter if available for stable connection.  
- Close background apps on mobile device.

metadata.section: 4. Issue: Poor video quality or lag

title: doorlock_battery_issues.md - 1. Issue: Low Battery Warning
content:
### Causes
- Batteries are nearing depletion  
- Using low-quality or non-rechargeable batteries  

### Solutions
1. Replace with **4 new AA alkaline batteries**.  
2. Use high-quality, branded batteries for longer life.  
3. Check that batteries are correctly oriented in the compartment.  

---

title: doorlock_battery_issues.md - 2. Issue: Lock not responding
content:
### Causes
- Batteries are dead  
- Loose battery contacts  

### Solutions
1. Remove battery pack and reinsert correctly.  
2. Clean contacts with a dry cloth to remove corrosion.  
3. Replace batteries if power still does not work.  

---

title: doorlock_battery_issues.md - 3. Issue: Frequent Low Battery Notifications
content:
### Causes
- High frequency of unlocks/usage  
- Extreme temperatures affecting battery life  

### Solutions
1. Replace with **high-capacity AA batteries**.  
2. Avoid exposure to extreme cold or heat.  
3. Enable energy-saving mode in the app if supported.  

---

title: doorlock_battery_issues.md - 4. Issue: Lock fails to operate after battery replacement
content:
### Solutions
1. Ensure **battery pack is fully seated** and screws are tightened.  
2. Perform **system reset** via interior module.  
3. Pair the lock again in the NeuraHome App.

metadata.section: 4. Issue: Lock fails to operate after battery replacement

title: edge_cases_error_handling.md - Edge Cases & Error Handling â€” Comprehensive Guide
content:
**NeuraHome Systems Troubleshooting**

---

metadata.section: Edge Cases & Error Handling â€” Comprehensive Guide

title: edge_cases_error_handling.md - 1. Overview
content:
This guide covers edge cases, uncommon scenarios, and advanced error handling for all NeuraHome devices. Use this when standard troubleshooting doesn't resolve your issue.

---

title: edge_cases_error_handling.md - 2. NH-Hub X1 Edge Cases
content:
### Hub Loses All Devices After Power Outage
**Symptoms:**
- Hub powers on but shows no connected devices
- Devices appear offline in app
- Automations stop working

**Causes:**
- Power outage corrupted hub memory
- Zigbee network coordinator lost
- WiFi credentials lost

**Solutions:**
1. **Soft Reset:**
   - Unplug hub for 30 seconds
   - Plug back in, wait 5 minutes
   - Check if devices reconnect automatically

title: edge_cases_error_handling.md - 2. NH-Hub X1 Edge Cases
content:
2. **Re-pair Devices:**
   - App â†’ Devices â†’ Add Device
   - Put each device in pairing mode
   - Re-add devices one by one

3. **Network Reset:**
   - App â†’ Hub Settings â†’ Network â†’ Reset
   - Re-enter WiFi password
   - Reconnect all devices

4. **Factory Reset (Last Resort):**
   - Press and hold reset button for 10 seconds
   - Hub LED flashes red
   - Reconfigure hub from scratch

title: edge_cases_error_handling.md - 2. NH-Hub X1 Edge Cases
content:
### Hub Shows Connected But Devices Don't Respond
**Symptoms:**
- Hub appears online
- Devices show as connected
- Commands don't execute
- Delayed or no response

**Causes:**
- Network congestion
- Interference from other devices
- Hub overloaded with too many devices
- Firmware bug

**Solutions:**
1. **Check Hub Load:**
   - App â†’ Hub Settings â†’ Performance
   - If CPU > 80% or Memory > 85%, reduce devices
   - Remove unused devices

title: edge_cases_error_handling.md - 2. NH-Hub X1 Edge Cases
content:
2. **Reduce Network Traffic:**
   - Disable unnecessary automations temporarily
   - Reduce automation frequency
   - Check for network loops

3. **Update Firmware:**
   - App â†’ Hub Settings â†’ Firmware Update
   - Install latest firmware
   - Often fixes communication bugs

4. **Restart Hub:**
   - App â†’ Hub Settings â†’ Restart
   - Wait 2 minutes for full restart
   - Test device control

title: edge_cases_error_handling.md - 2. NH-Hub X1 Edge Cases
content:
### Hub Cannot Connect to Cloud
**Symptoms:**
- Hub works locally but cloud features fail
- Remote access doesn't work
- App shows "Hub Offline" when away
- Cloud sync errors

**Causes:**
- Internet connection issue
- Firewall blocking hub
- Cloud service outage
- DNS resolution failure

**Solutions:**
1. **Check Internet Connection:**
   - Hub Settings â†’ Network â†’ Test Connection
   - Verify hub can reach internet
   - Check router internet status

title: edge_cases_error_handling.md - 2. NH-Hub X1 Edge Cases
content:
2. **Firewall Configuration:**
   - Allow hub IP through firewall
   - Open ports: 443 (HTTPS), 8883 (MQTT)
   - Check router firewall settings

3. **DNS Settings:**
   - Hub Settings â†’ Network â†’ DNS
   - Try Google DNS: 8.8.8.8, 8.8.4.4
   - Or Cloudflare DNS: 1.1.1.1, 1.0.0.1

4. **Check Cloud Status:**
   - Visit neurahome.com/status
   - Check for service outages
   - Wait if maintenance in progress

title: edge_cases_error_handling.md - 2. NH-Hub X1 Edge Cases
content:
### Hub Zigbee Network Interference
**Symptoms:**
- Devices disconnect randomly
- Slow response times
- Failed commands
- Range issues

**Causes:**
- WiFi interference on same channel
- Other Zigbee networks nearby
- Physical obstructions
- Too many devices on one channel

**Solutions:**
1. **Change Zigbee Channel:**
   - Hub Settings â†’ Zigbee â†’ Channel
   - Use channel scanner to find best channel
   - Avoid WiFi channels (1, 6, 11)
   - Try channels 15, 20, or 25

title: edge_cases_error_handling.md - 2. NH-Hub X1 Edge Cases
content:
2. **Reduce WiFi Interference:**
   - Move hub away from router
   - Use 5 GHz WiFi instead of 2.4 GHz
   - Reduce 2.4 GHz device count

3. **Add Zigbee Repeater:**
   - Install Zigbee smart plug as repeater
   - Extends network range
   - Improves signal strength

4. **Reposition Hub:**
   - Place hub centrally in home
   - Avoid metal enclosures
   - Keep away from large appliances

---

title: edge_cases_error_handling.md - 3. NH-Cam Pro 360 Edge Cases
content:
### Camera Records But Shows Black Screen
**Symptoms:**
- Camera appears online
- Recording indicator active
- Playback shows black screen
- No video feed in app

**Causes:**
- Lens cap or obstruction
- IR filter stuck
- Sensor failure
- Firmware corruption

**Solutions:**
1. **Check Physical Obstructions:**
   - Remove any lens cap
   - Clean lens with microfiber cloth
   - Check for stickers or covers

title: edge_cases_error_handling.md - 3. NH-Cam Pro 360 Edge Cases
content:
2. **Reset IR Filter:**
   - App â†’ Camera Settings â†’ Night Vision â†’ Reset
   - Toggle night vision on/off
   - Restart camera

3. **Firmware Recovery:**
   - App â†’ Camera Settings â†’ Firmware â†’ Recovery Mode
   - Reinstall firmware
   - May require manual update via USB

4. **Hardware Check:**
   - If all software fixes fail, likely sensor issue
   - Contact support for replacement
   - Check warranty status

title: edge_cases_error_handling.md - 3. NH-Cam Pro 360 Edge Cases
content:
### Camera Motion Detection Too Sensitive
**Symptoms:**
- Constant motion alerts
- False alarms from shadows, trees, cars
- Too many notifications
- Storage filling up quickly

**Causes:**
- Sensitivity set too high
- No detection zones configured
- AI detection not enabled
- Environmental factors (wind, lighting)

**Solutions:**
1. **Adjust Sensitivity:**
   - Camera Settings â†’ Motion â†’ Sensitivity â†’ Low
   - Test for 24 hours
   - Increase gradually if needed

title: edge_cases_error_handling.md - 3. NH-Cam Pro 360 Edge Cases
content:
2. **Set Detection Zones:**
   - Camera Settings â†’ Motion â†’ Zones
   - Draw zones only where motion matters
   - Exclude trees, roads, neighbor's property

3. **Enable AI Detection:**
   - Camera Settings â†’ Motion â†’ AI Detection
   - Enable "Person Detection Only"
   - Reduces false alarms significantly

4. **Environmental Adjustments:**
   - Reposition camera to avoid moving objects
   - Adjust camera angle
   - Add physical barriers (fence, plants)

title: edge_cases_error_handling.md - 3. NH-Cam Pro 360 Edge Cases
content:
### Camera SD Card Errors
**Symptoms:**
- "SD Card Error" message
- Recordings not saving
- Card not detected
- Corrupted files

**Causes:**
- SD card incompatible
- Card corrupted
- Card full
- Card speed too slow
- Physical damage

**Solutions:**
1. **Check Card Compatibility:**
   - Use Class 10 or UHS-I cards
   - Minimum 32GB, recommended 64-256GB
   - Format: FAT32 or exFAT
   - Avoid no-name brands

title: edge_cases_error_handling.md - 3. NH-Cam Pro 360 Edge Cases
content:
2. **Format SD Card:**
   - Remove card from camera
   - Format on computer (FAT32)
   - Reinsert and format in app
   - App â†’ Camera Settings â†’ Storage â†’ Format

3. **Check Card Health:**
   - Test card in computer
   - Run disk check utility
   - Replace if errors found

4. **Replace Card:**
   - Use high-quality SD card
   - SanDisk, Samsung, or Kingston recommended
   - Avoid used or refurbished cards

title: edge_cases_error_handling.md - 3. NH-Cam Pro 360 Edge Cases
content:
### Camera Night Vision Not Working
**Symptoms:**
- Black and white video at night
- No IR illumination
- Poor night vision quality
- IR LEDs not turning on

**Causes:**
- IR LEDs failed
- IR filter stuck
- Settings misconfigured
- Low light mode enabled incorrectly

**Solutions:**
1. **Check IR Settings:**
   - Camera Settings â†’ Night Vision â†’ Mode
   - Set to "Auto" or "Always On"
   - Disable "Low-Light Color" if IR not working

title: edge_cases_error_handling.md - 3. NH-Cam Pro 360 Edge Cases
content:
2. **Test IR LEDs:**
   - Cover camera lens with hand
   - Look for red glow from IR LEDs
   - If no glow, LEDs may be failed

3. **Reset Night Vision:**
   - Toggle night vision off/on
   - Restart camera
   - Update firmware

4. **Hardware Replacement:**
   - If IR LEDs failed, contact support
   - May require camera replacement
   - Check warranty coverage

title: edge_cases_error_handling.md - 4. NH-Lock Secure+ Edge Cases
content:
### Lock Unlocks But Doesn't Lock
**Symptoms:**
- Unlock works normally
- Lock command doesn't work
- Auto-lock not functioning
- Manual lock via keypad fails

**Causes:**
- Motor mechanism issue
- Deadbolt alignment problem
- Low battery
- Mechanical obstruction

**Solutions:**
1. **Check Battery:**
   - Replace batteries (even if not low)
   - Use high-quality alkaline batteries
   - Check battery orientation

title: edge_cases_error_handling.md - 4. NH-Lock Secure+ Edge Cases
content:
2. **Test Manual Lock:**
   - Try locking with physical key
   - If key works, issue is electronic
   - If key doesn't work, mechanical issue

3. **Check Deadbolt Alignment:**
   - Open door and check strike plate
   - Deadbolt should align with hole
   - Adjust strike plate if misaligned

4. **Motor Reset:**
   - Remove batteries for 30 seconds
   - Reinsert batteries
   - Try lock command again
   - May need motor replacement if persists

title: edge_cases_error_handling.md - 4. NH-Lock Secure+ Edge Cases
content:
### Lock Shows "Offline" But Works Locally
**Symptoms:**
- Lock works with keypad and app locally
- Shows "Offline" in app
- Remote unlock doesn't work
- No cloud connectivity

**Causes:**
- WiFi connection lost
- Router blocking lock
- Cloud sync issue
- Lock WiFi module issue

**Solutions:**
1. **Check WiFi Connection:**
   - Lock Settings â†’ Network â†’ Test Connection
   - Verify lock can reach router
   - Check signal strength (should be > -70 dBm)

title: edge_cases_error_handling.md - 4. NH-Lock Secure+ Edge Cases
content:
2. **Reconnect WiFi:**
   - Lock Settings â†’ Network â†’ WiFi â†’ Reconnect
   - Re-enter WiFi password
   - Wait 2 minutes for connection

3. **Router Configuration:**
   - Ensure 2.4 GHz WiFi enabled
   - Check MAC filtering (add lock MAC if enabled)
   - Verify router not blocking device

4. **Reset Network:**
   - Lock Settings â†’ Network â†’ Reset
   - Re-pair lock to WiFi
   - May require re-adding lock in app

title: edge_cases_error_handling.md - 4. NH-Lock Secure+ Edge Cases
content:
### Lock Fingerprint Recognition Fails After Working
**Symptoms:**
- Fingerprint worked before
- Now fails consistently
- Other fingerprints work
- Specific finger not recognized

**Causes:**
- Fingerprint sensor dirty
- Finger condition changed (dry, wet, injured)
- Sensor calibration drift
- Too many failed attempts

**Solutions:**
1. **Clean Sensor:**
   - Use microfiber cloth
   - Gently wipe sensor surface
   - Avoid chemicals or water
   - Dry completely before use

title: edge_cases_error_handling.md - 4. NH-Lock Secure+ Edge Cases
content:
2. **Re-enroll Fingerprint:**
   - App â†’ User Management â†’ Select User
   - Remove old fingerprint
   - Re-enroll same finger
   - Enroll multiple times for better accuracy

3. **Try Different Finger:**
   - Enroll index finger instead of thumb
   - Index fingers often work better
   - Enroll both index fingers

4. **Check Finger Condition:**
   - Ensure finger is clean and dry
   - Avoid using if finger is injured
   - Moisturize if skin is very dry
   - Wait if finger is wet

title: edge_cases_error_handling.md - 4. NH-Lock Secure+ Edge Cases
content:
### Lock Auto-Lock Not Working
**Symptoms:**
- Door closes but doesn't auto-lock
- Auto-lock delay not functioning
- Manual lock required every time

**Causes:**
- Auto-lock disabled
- Delay set too long
- Door sensor not detecting close
- Mechanical issue

**Solutions:**
1. **Check Auto-Lock Settings:**
   - Lock Settings â†’ Auto-Lock â†’ Enable
   - Set delay (5-30 seconds recommended)
   - Test with door close

title: edge_cases_error_handling.md - 4. NH-Lock Secure+ Edge Cases
content:
2. **Verify Door Sensor:**
   - Lock should detect door position
   - Check if door fully closes
   - Adjust door if needed

3. **Test Auto-Lock:**
   - Close door and wait
   - Watch lock LED (should flash then lock)
   - If no response, sensor may be faulty

4. **Manual Override:**
   - Use manual lock (hold * for 2 seconds)
   - Or lock via app
   - Contact support if auto-lock hardware failed

title: edge_cases_error_handling.md - 5. NH-Bulb Glow RGB+ Edge Cases
content:

content:
2. **Improve WiFi Signal:**

title: edge_cases_error_handling.md - 6. General Edge Cases
content:
### Multiple Devices Offline Simultaneously
**Symptoms:**
- Several devices go offline at once
- Hub still online
- Network appears fine
- Affects multiple device types

**Causes:**
- Router restart or firmware update
- Network-wide power outage
- ISP internet outage
- Router configuration change

**Solutions:**
1. **Check Router Status:**
   - Verify router is online
   - Check router admin panel
   - Restart router if needed

title: edge_cases_error_handling.md - 6. General Edge Cases
content:
2. **Wait for Auto-Reconnect:**
   - Devices usually reconnect automatically
   - Wait 5-10 minutes
   - Check app for reconnection

3. **Manual Reconnect:**
   - App â†’ Devices â†’ Select Offline Device
   - Tap "Reconnect" or "Refresh"
   - Re-enter WiFi password if prompted

4. **Network Reset:**
   - If many devices offline, reset network
   - Reconfigure router settings
   - Re-add devices if necessary

title: edge_cases_error_handling.md - 6. General Edge Cases
content:
### App Shows Wrong Device Status
**Symptoms:**
- App shows device on but it's off
- Status doesn't update
- Controls don't match reality
- Sync issues

**Causes:**
- Cloud sync delay
- Local cache issue
- Device not reporting status
- App bug

**Solutions:**
1. **Refresh App:**
   - Pull down to refresh device list
   - Or close and reopen app
   - Wait for status update

2. **Clear App Cache:**
   - Phone Settings â†’ Apps â†’ NeuraHome â†’ Clear Cache
   - Restart app
   - Status should update

title: edge_cases_error_handling.md - 6. General Edge Cases
content:
3. **Force Sync:**
   - App â†’ Settings â†’ Sync â†’ Force Sync
   - Wait for sync to complete
   - Check device status

4. **Restart Device:**
   - Power cycle the device
   - Device will report correct status
   - App should update

### Firmware Update Fails
**Symptoms:**
- Update starts but fails
- Device stuck in update mode
- Error messages during update
- Device becomes unresponsive

title: edge_cases_error_handling.md - 6. General Edge Cases
content:
**Causes:**
- Internet connection lost during update
- Low battery/power
- Insufficient storage
- Corrupted firmware file

**Solutions:**
1. **Check Prerequisites:**
   - Ensure device battery > 40%
   - Verify stable internet connection
   - Check available storage space

2. **Retry Update:**
   - Wait 10 minutes
   - Retry firmware update
   - Often works on second attempt

title: edge_cases_error_handling.md - 6. General Edge Cases
content:
3. **Recovery Mode:**
   - For hub: Hold reset button during power-on
   - For other devices: Follow device-specific recovery
   - Reinstall firmware manually

4. **Contact Support:**
   - If device stuck, contact support immediately
   - May need replacement if recovery fails
   - Check warranty status

title: edge_cases_error_handling.md - 8. Advanced Recovery Procedures
content:
### Factory Reset Procedures

#### Hub Factory Reset
1. Unplug hub from power
2. Press and hold reset button
3. While holding, plug in power
4. Continue holding for 10 seconds
5. LED flashes red rapidly
6. Release button
7. Wait 5 minutes for reset
8. Reconfigure hub from scratch

title: edge_cases_error_handling.md - 8. Advanced Recovery Procedures
content:
#### Lock Factory Reset
1. Remove batteries
2. Press and hold `*` and `#` simultaneously
3. While holding, reinsert batteries
4. Continue holding for 10 seconds
5. Keypad flashes all colors
6. Release buttons
7. Lock resets to factory defaults

#### Camera Factory Reset
1. Power off camera
2. Press and hold reset button (usually inside)
3. While holding, power on camera
4. Continue holding for 15 seconds
5. LED flashes yellow rapidly
6. Release button
7. Camera resets (requires re-pairing)

title: edge_cases_error_handling.md - 8. Advanced Recovery Procedures
content:
#### Bulb Factory Reset
1. Turn bulb on
2. Turn off/on 5 times quickly (within 5 seconds)
3. Bulb flashes white 3 times
4. Bulb is reset
5. Re-add in app

content:
Contact NeuraHome support immediately if:

- Warranty claim needed
- Advanced technical assistance required

**Support Channels:**

- **Hotline:** +1-800-NEURA-HOME (24/7)

content:
### Regular Maintenance
- **Weekly:** Check device status, review activity logs
- **Monthly:** Update firmware, clean sensors, check batteries
- **Quarterly:** Review and optimize automations, remove unused devices

### Best Practices
- Keep firmware updated
- Use quality batteries and power supplies
- Maintain strong WiFi signal
- Regular backups of settings
- Document device configurations

title: firmware_update_errors.md - 1. Issue: Firmware update fails
content:
### Causes
- Poor Wi-Fi connection  
- Device battery low  
- App or server issue  

### Solutions
1. Ensure device is **powered and fully charged** or connected to mains.  
2. Verify stable **2.4 GHz Wi-Fi** connection.  
3. Retry update in the NeuraHome app.  
4. Restart device and app before attempting update again.  

---

title: firmware_update_errors.md - 2. Issue: Device LED blinks red during update
content:
### Causes
- Interrupted update  
- Network drop  

### Solutions
1. Power cycle device.  
2. Reconnect to Wi-Fi and retry update.  
3. If issue persists, contact support for manual firmware update instructions.  

---

metadata.section: 3. Issue: Device becomes unresponsive after update

title: hub_wifi_troubleshooting.md - 1. Issue: Hub not connecting to Wi-Fi
content:
### Causes
- Incorrect Wi-Fi password  
- 5 GHz network selected (Hub supports 2.4 GHz & 5 GHz)  
- Router signal too weak  

### Solutions
1. Verify Wi-Fi password and re-enter in the app.  
2. Ensure correct Wi-Fi band is selected (2.4 GHz recommended for distance).  
3. Move hub closer to router or remove obstacles.  
4. Restart hub and router.

**NeuraHome Systems**

metadata.section: Network Connectivity Issues â€” Comprehensive Troubleshooting

title: network_connectivity_issues.md - 1. Overview
content:
Network connectivity issues can affect all NeuraHome devices. This guide covers WiFi, Ethernet, Zigbee, and Bluetooth connectivity problems.

---

title: network_connectivity_issues.md - 2. WiFi Connectivity Issues
content:
### Device Cannot Connect to WiFi
**Symptoms:**
- Device shows "WiFi Connection Failed"
- Cannot complete setup
- Device offline after working

**Solutions:**
1. **Verify WiFi Requirements:**
   - Most devices require **2.4 GHz WiFi** (not 5 GHz)
   - Check router has 2.4 GHz enabled
   - Some devices support both (Hub X1)

2. **Check WiFi Password:**
   - Ensure password is correct
   - No special characters causing issues
   - Try re-entering password

title: network_connectivity_issues.md - 2. WiFi Connectivity Issues
content:
3. **Signal Strength:**
   - Move device closer to router
   - Check signal strength (should be > -70 dBm)
   - Remove physical obstructions

4. **Router Settings:**
   - Disable MAC filtering temporarily
   - Check device limit on router
   - Ensure router not blocking device

### WiFi Keeps Disconnecting
**Symptoms:**
- Device connects then disconnects
- Intermittent connectivity
- Works sometimes, not others

title: network_connectivity_issues.md - 2. WiFi Connectivity Issues
content:
**Solutions:**
1. **Router Channel Interference:**
   - Change router WiFi channel
   - Use WiFi analyzer to find best channel
   - Avoid crowded channels (1, 6, 11)

2. **Power Saving Mode:**
   - Disable WiFi power saving on router
   - Some routers disconnect idle devices
   - Check router settings

3. **DHCP Lease Time:**
   - Increase DHCP lease time
   - Set to 24 hours or longer
   - Prevents IP address conflicts

title: network_connectivity_issues.md - 2. WiFi Connectivity Issues
content:
4. **Router Firmware:**
   - Update router firmware
   - Old firmware may have bugs
   - Check router manufacturer website

### Slow WiFi Performance
**Symptoms:**
- Commands take long to execute
- Delayed responses
- Timeouts

**Solutions:**
1. **Reduce Network Load:**
   - Disconnect unused devices
   - Limit bandwidth-heavy activities
   - Prioritize smart home traffic

2. **Upgrade Router:**
   - Older routers may be slow
   - Consider WiFi 6 router
   - Better handling of many devices

title: network_connectivity_issues.md - 2. WiFi Connectivity Issues
content:
3. **Mesh Network:**
   - Add WiFi extenders or mesh nodes
   - Improves coverage and speed
   - Reduces dead zones

---

title: network_connectivity_issues.md - 3. Zigbee Network Issues
content:
### Zigbee Devices Not Pairing
**Symptoms:**
- Device not discovered by hub
- Pairing fails
- "Device Not Found" errors

**Solutions:**
1. **Check Hub Zigbee Status:**
   - Hub Settings â†’ Zigbee â†’ Status
   - Ensure Zigbee coordinator active
   - Restart hub if needed

2. **Distance and Obstacles:**
   - Move device closer to hub
   - Zigbee range: ~30-50 meters indoors
   - Reduce obstacles (walls, metal)

title: network_connectivity_issues.md - 3. Zigbee Network Issues
content:
3. **Zigbee Channel:**
   - Change Zigbee channel if interference
   - Avoid WiFi channels (1, 6, 11)
   - Use channels 15, 20, or 25

4. **Device-Specific:**
   - Follow device pairing instructions exactly
   - Some devices have specific pairing modes
   - Check device manual

### Zigbee Devices Disconnect Randomly
**Symptoms:**
- Devices work then go offline
- Intermittent connectivity
- Range issues

title: network_connectivity_issues.md - 3. Zigbee Network Issues
content:
**Solutions:**
1. **Add Zigbee Repeater:**
   - Install Zigbee smart plug
   - Acts as signal repeater
   - Extends network range

2. **Reduce Interference:**
   - Move hub away from WiFi router
   - Avoid 2.4 GHz devices nearby
   - Use 5 GHz WiFi if possible

3. **Network Topology:**
   - Ensure mesh network formed
   - Devices should route through each other
   - Check network map in app

title: network_connectivity_issues.md - 3. Zigbee Network Issues
content:
4. **Power Issues:**
   - Battery devices may disconnect if low
   - Check battery levels
   - Replace batteries

---

title: network_connectivity_issues.md - 4. Bluetooth Connectivity Issues
content:
### Bluetooth Pairing Fails
**Symptoms:**
- Device not discovered
- Pairing timeout
- "Bluetooth Error" messages

**Solutions:**
1. **Phone Settings:**
   - Enable Bluetooth and Location
   - Some phones require location for BLE
   - Grant app permissions

2. **Distance:**
   - Move phone within 1 meter of device
   - Bluetooth range is limited
   - Remove obstacles

3. **Interference:**
   - Turn off other Bluetooth devices
   - Reduce WiFi interference
   - Try different location

title: network_connectivity_issues.md - 4. Bluetooth Connectivity Issues
content:
4. **App Permissions:**
   - Check app has Bluetooth permission
   - Re-grant if needed
   - Restart app

### Bluetooth Connection Drops
**Symptoms:**
- Connection works then drops
- Unstable connection
- Reconnection required

**Solutions:**
1. **Phone Bluetooth:**
   - Restart phone Bluetooth
   - Clear Bluetooth cache
   - Update phone OS

2. **Device Battery:**
   - Low battery affects Bluetooth
   - Replace batteries
   - Check power supply

title: network_connectivity_issues.md - 4. Bluetooth Connectivity Issues
content:
3. **Interference:**
   - Move away from WiFi router
   - Reduce other 2.4 GHz devices
   - Use 5 GHz WiFi

---

title: network_connectivity_issues.md - 5. Ethernet Connectivity Issues
content:
### Ethernet Not Working
**Symptoms:**
- Hub shows "Ethernet Disconnected"
- No network via Ethernet
- Falls back to WiFi

**Solutions:**
1. **Cable Check:**
   - Test cable with another device
   - Ensure cable not damaged
   - Try different cable

2. **Port Check:**
   - Try different router port
   - Check port not disabled
   - Verify port working

3. **Hub Settings:**
   - Hub Settings â†’ Network â†’ Ethernet
   - Enable Ethernet priority
   - Check Ethernet status

title: network_connectivity_issues.md - 5. Ethernet Connectivity Issues
content:
4. **Router Configuration:**
   - Check router port settings
   - Ensure port not blocked
   - Verify router firmware

---

title: network_connectivity_issues.md - 6. Network-Wide Issues
content:
### All Devices Offline
**Symptoms:**
- Multiple devices offline
- Hub still online
- Network appears fine

**Solutions:**
1. **Check Internet:**
   - Test internet connection
   - Check ISP status
   - Verify router internet

2. **Router Restart:**
   - Restart router
   - Wait 5 minutes
   - Devices should reconnect

3. **Cloud Service:**
   - Check neurahome.com/status
   - Service may be down
   - Wait for resolution

title: network_connectivity_issues.md - 6. Network-Wide Issues
content:
### Slow Response Times
**Symptoms:**
- Commands take long
- Delayed execution
- Timeouts

**Solutions:**
1. **Network Load:**
   - Reduce network traffic
   - Limit bandwidth usage
   - Prioritize smart home

2. **Router Performance:**
   - Check router CPU usage
   - Too many devices may overload
   - Consider router upgrade

3. **Local Processing:**
   - Enable local processing on hub
   - Reduces cloud dependency
   - Faster response

---

title: network_connectivity_issues.md - 7. Advanced Network Troubleshooting
content:
### Port Forwarding Issues
**Symptoms:**
- Remote access doesn't work
- Port forwarding configured but fails
- External access blocked

**Solutions:**
1. **Verify Ports:**
   - Required ports: 443 (HTTPS), 8883 (MQTT)
   - Check firewall allows ports
   - Verify port forwarding rules

2. **Dynamic DNS:**
   - Use dynamic DNS service
   - Updates IP automatically
   - Easier than static IP

title: network_connectivity_issues.md - 7. Advanced Network Troubleshooting
content:
3. **VPN Alternative:**
   - Use VPN for remote access
   - More secure than port forwarding
   - Works behind firewalls

### Network Segmentation
**Symptoms:**
- Devices on different networks can't communicate
- VLAN isolation issues
- Guest network problems

**Solutions:**
1. **Network Configuration:**
   - Ensure devices on same network
   - Check VLAN settings
   - Allow inter-device communication

title: network_connectivity_issues.md - 7. Advanced Network Troubleshooting
content:
2. **Guest Network:**
   - Most devices need main network
   - Guest networks often isolated
   - Move devices to main network

3. **Firewall Rules:**
   - Allow device-to-device communication
   - Check firewall rules
   - May need router configuration

---

title: network_connectivity_issues.md - 8. Support
content:
For network issues:
- **Email:** support@neurahome.com
- **Hotline:** +1-800-NEURA-HOME
- **Network Support:** Available for complex setups
